title: Israelgogo
author: Israelgogo
content: Incases of a consistent member who has been in the forum for too long and always participating and contributing in discussions but yet do not get an opportunity to get payed for his contribution and been employed in here ,should the person continue putting more effort and keep pushing even after several effort and yet no opportunity for payment. Forum opportunities and referals to successful jobs that have helped in the past will help give everyone a sense of belonging.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: For better understanding you are asking why should one contribute to the forum or make quality posts if he/she is not getting paid for it. For me I think itâ€™s a personal decision, you can decide to wear an avatar and join a signature campaign the rules are not against earning money legitimately. The only problem I see is making bounties, signature campaigns your sole aim of being here.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, this is a post you should print out and read aloud every morning. Because there are a lot of similar motivational posts in the section for beginners, but unfortunately, few people really follow them. I find posts like this from newbies a little silly since such words should come from people who can talk about their experience.But I read your posts and I see that you are trying, so I will give you the first merit as a motivation for further development. If you ever think that being on this forum is a waste of time, just go back to your topic. Try not to give up, and you will certainly join this society and will be able to give advice on diligence to future newcomers.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Bruh, here we are again with newbies trying to give motivational advice to people about growing or whatever. Haven't seen one in like, 12 whole minutes.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Israelgogo on May 17, 2022, 11:46:36 AMForum opportunities and referals to successful jobs that have helped in the past will help give everyone a sense of belonging.Wrong. This is a community and quality discussions with other forum members is what gives a sense of belonging. Even contributions which are not public like reports to moderators are very useful.If there are any threads at all where a user asks a question or makes an inquiry and gets a useful response, that right there represents the forum.If the sole purpose here is to get paid, then you would find it difficult contributing and you do not have to, if you feel you're not getting the benefit you desire from it.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on May 17, 2022, 01:47:19 PMBut I read your posts and I see that you are trying, so I will give you the first merit as a motivation for further development.I like the reason for which you merited OP. I wanted to second you but unfortunately I lacked merit to do that. We all need encouragement to bring out the best in one another. The globe is becoming a tougher place unlike what it was a few decades ago. People are really going through a lot this day. Depression and frustration may be biting and hitting hard on people who won't voice it for fear of getting mocked.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Israelgogo on May 17, 2022, 11:46:36 AMIncases of a consistent member who has been in the forum for too long and always participating and contributing in discussions but yet do not get an opportunity to get payed for his contribution and been employed in here ,should the person continue putting more effort and keep pushing even after several effort and yet no opportunity for payment. Don't let money be the driving force for you being here OP, else you will easily get discouraged when things do not go as you want. The forum offers an opportunity to earn stipends, it is not an entitlement. It will interest you to know OP that there are some high ranking consistent members here who have no need for the stipends maybe due to their economy, are not members of any signature campaign but still gainfully contribute. It is a choice.
